title: Which k-pop idols are not Asian? - Quora

response.answer_text: Edit: Koki and Lana have joined the first list as they are both of part Asian decent Theres two sets, the ones who are ethnically Asian, but have nationalities outside of Asia, and the ones who aren't even Asian to begin with, but may have nationality in an Asian country. Šime Košta-- EXP EDITION Member  Nationality: Croatian/ American Ethnicity: Slavic Place of birth: Zadar, Croatia  Well thanks for reading  Kai loves you Quora's best friend

No, at the moment I don’t think there are any active idols who are completely non Asian. There are a few who are half asian like Seventeen’s Vernon, Samuel (solo artist), Momoland’s Nancy. The only Non Asian that I know of who debuted in an Idol group was BP Rania’s Alex who is American. But her company basically used her as a prop to get attention for the group. She had a small music career in the US, the company basically contacted her and put her in the group without actually training her. The company treated her pretty poorly, they wouldn’t let her promote with the group most of the time, left her out of the first music video with them, and the few times they did include her in performances they just had her walk up, Rap, then walk off. I think there was only one comeback where they actually included her in the choreography. In the end, when the company realized they weren’t getting any more attention with her, they kicked her out of the group. I think there was another group called Oh My Jewel who had a Russian girl in the line up but I don’t think that group actually debuted. And if there were any other groups with nonasian members, they weren’t successful.   So yeah, while Kpop has expanded to include foreign members, they haven’t expanded past East Asians. Keep in mind, Korea in general is still a very conservative and close off country who doesn’t take well to foreigner taking jobs from their citizens. The entertainment industry of course is a lot more open and there have been a handful of Non Asian variety stars who’ve made a career of appearing on korean shows but when it comes to Kpop Idol groups, I think we probably have another generation before we start seeing non Asian idols if at all. At the end of the day, they’re creating a Korean Pop group, emphasis on the “Korean” so you gotta look the part just as much as being able to perform it.
